title: Prayer for Protection
shortSummary: Psalm 64 is a heartfelt prayer by David seeking God's protection from secret enemies who plot evil with harmful words. It highlights the certainty of God's justice and the ultimate downfall of the wicked, encouraging the righteous to trust and rejoice in the Lord.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - Reign of King David

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The author of this Psalm, King of Israel, who prays for deliverance from his enemies.

keyCharacters.name: The Wicked
keyCharacters.description: Enemies who secretly plot harm and speak malicious words against the righteous.

definitions.definition: The leader of worship or choir in the temple, responsible for directing the musical aspect of the Psalm.
Refers to the blameless or upright person who lives in integrity before God.
A metaphor describing sharp, cutting, and harmful speech used by the wicked.
Traps or schemes intended to cause harm or capture the innocent.

outline.heading: David’s Prayer for Protection
outline.description: David calls on God to hear his prayer and protect him from the fear and secret plots of his enemies, emphasizing his dependence on divine safeguarding.

outline.heading: Description of the Wicked’s Schemes
outline.description: The Psalmist describes the enemies’ malicious words and secret plans, likening their speech to sharpened swords and their intentions to hidden arrows aimed at the righteous.

outline.heading: God’s Judgment on the Wicked
outline.description: God is portrayed as the divine archer who will suddenly wound the wicked, causing their own words to bring about their downfall and fear among onlookers.

outline.heading: The Righteous Rejoice in God’s Justice
outline.description: The Psalm concludes with the righteous rejoicing and trusting in the Lord, confidently glorifying Him for His wise and just actions.

application: Trust God in times of fear and danger, bringing all concerns to Him in prayer.
Be vigilant against the harmful words and secret schemes of others, relying on God’s justice rather than personal retaliation.
Rejoice and find confidence in God’s righteous judgment, knowing He defends the upright heart.
Maintain integrity and uprightness, trusting that God honors and protects those who seek Him.

keyVerses.text: Hear my voice, O God, in my prayer: preserve my life from fear of the enemy.
keyVerses.significance: This verse sets the tone of the Psalm as a prayer for divine protection amid threats.

keyVerses.text: Who whet their tongue like a sword, and bend their bows to shoot their arrows, even bitter words:
keyVerses.significance: It vividly illustrates the power of malicious speech as a weapon against the righteous.

keyVerses.text: But God shall shoot at them with an arrow; suddenly shall they be wounded.
keyVerses.significance: This verse affirms God’s active role in defending His people and punishing the wicked.

keyVerses.text: The righteous shall be glad in the LORD, and shall trust in him; and all the upright in heart shall glory.
keyVerses.significance: It encourages believers to rejoice and place their full trust in God’s faithfulness and justice.
